name: ü§ñ Support par e-mail AI auto-am√©liorant avec intervention humaine
description:
## Comment √ßa fonctionne

Ce flux de travail cr√©e un syst√®me de support client sophistiqu√© et auto-am√©liorant qui g√®re automatiquement les e-mails entrants. Il est con√ßu pour r√©pondre aux questions courantes en utilisant une base de connaissances aliment√©e par l'IA et, surtout, pour apprendre des experts humains lorsque de nouvelles questions ou des questions complexes se posent, √©largissant continuellement ses capacit√©s.

Pensez-y comme √† un assistant IA avec une m√©moire intelligente et un mentor humain. Voici le processus √©tape par √©tape :

1.  **Nouvel e-mail re√ßu :** Le flux de travail est d√©clench√© chaque fois qu'un nouvel e-mail arrive dans votre bo√Æte de r√©ception de support d√©sign√©e (via Gmail).
2.  **Classer la demande :** Un mod√®le d'IA (`Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite`) classe d'abord l'e-mail entrant pour s'assurer qu'il s'agit d'une v√©ritable demande de support, filtrant les messages non pertinents.
3.  **R√©cup√©rer la base de connaissances :** Le flux de travail r√©cup√®re toutes les paires de questions et r√©ponses existantes de votre base de connaissances d√©di√©e dans Google Sheets.
4.  **Tentative de r√©ponse par l'IA :** Un puissant mod√®le d'IA (`Google Gemini 2.5 Pro`) analyse l'e-mail du client par rapport √† l'ensemble de la base de connaissances. Il tente de trouver une r√©ponse hautement pertinente et r√©dige une r√©ponse par e-mail HTML compl√®te si cela r√©ussit.
5.  **Point de d√©cision :** Un n≈ìud `IF` v√©rifie si l'IA a trouv√© une r√©ponse confiante.
    *   **Si r√©ponse trouv√©e :** La r√©ponse HTML g√©n√©r√©e par l'IA est imm√©diatement renvoy√©e au client via Gmail.
    *   **Si aucune r√©ponse trouv√©e (intervention humaine) :**
        *   **Escalader √† un humain :** La question r√©sum√©e du client et l'e-mail original sont transf√©r√©s √† un expert humain (vous ou votre √©quipe) via Gmail, demandant leur assistance.
        *   **R√©ponse humaine et apprentissage de l'IA :** Le flux de travail attend la r√©ponse de l'expert humain. Une fois re√ßue, un autre mod√®le d'IA (`Google Gemini 2.5 Flash`) traite √† la fois la question originale du client et la r√©ponse de l'expert pour les distiller en une nouvelle paire de questions/r√©ponses g√©n√©rique et r√©utilisable.
        *   **Mettre √† jour la base de connaissances :** Cette nouvelle paire Q&R est ensuite automatiquement ajout√©e en tant que nouvelle ligne √† votre base de connaissances Google Sheets, garantissant que le syst√®me peut r√©pondre automatiquement √† des questions similaires √† l'avenir.

## √âtapes de configuration

**Temps de configuration : ~10-15 minutes**

Ce flux de travail n√©cessite de connecter vos comptes Gmail et Google Sheets, et d'obtenir une cl√© API Google AI. Suivez ces √©tapes attentivement :

1.  **Connectez votre compte Gmail :**
    *   S√©lectionnez le n≈ìud `On New Email Received`.
    *   Cliquez sur le menu d√©roulant **Credential** et s√©lectionnez **`+ Cr√©er un nouveau credential`** pour connecter votre compte Gmail. Accordez les autorisations n√©cessaires.
    *   R√©p√©tez cela pour les n≈ìuds `Send AI Answer` et `Ask Human for Help`, en s√©lectionnant le credential que vous venez de cr√©er.

2.  **Connectez votre compte Google Sheets :**
    *   S√©lectionnez le n≈ìud `Get Knowledge Base`.
    *   Cliquez sur le menu d√©roulant **Credential** et s√©lectionnez **`+ Cr√©er un nouveau credential`** pour connecter votre compte Google. Accordez les autorisations n√©cessaires.
    *   R√©p√©tez cela pour le n≈ìud `Add to Knowledge Base`, en s√©lectionnant le credential que vous venez de cr√©er.

3.  **Configurez votre base de connaissances Google Sheet :**
    *   **Cr√©ez une nouvelle feuille Google** dans votre Google Drive.
    *   Renommez la premi√®re feuille (onglet) en `QA Database`.
    *   Dans la premi√®re ligne de `QA Database`, ajoutez deux en-t√™tes de colonne : `Question` (dans la cellule A1) et `R√©ponse` (dans la cellule B1).
    *   Retournez au n≈ìud `Get Knowledge Base` dans n8n. Dans le champ **Document ID**, s√©lectionnez votre nouvelle feuille Google cr√©√©e. Faites de m√™me pour le n≈ìud `Add to Knowledge Base`.

4.  **Obtenez votre cl√© API Google AI (pour les mod√®les Gemini) :**
    *   Visitez Google AI Studio √† [aistudio.google.com/app/apikey](https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey).
    *   Cliquez sur **"Cr√©er une cl√© API dans un nouveau projet"** et copiez la cl√©.
    *   Dans le flux de travail, allez au n≈ìud `Google Gemini 2.5 Pro`, cliquez sur le menu d√©roulant **Credential**, et s√©lectionnez **`+ Cr√©er un nouveau credential`**.
    *   Collez votre cl√© dans le champ **API Key** et **Enregistrer**.
    *   R√©p√©tez cela pour les n≈ìuds `Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite` et `Google Gemini 2.5 Flash`, en s√©lectionnant le credential que vous venez de cr√©er.

5.  **Configurer l'e-mail de l'expert humain :**
    *   S√©lectionnez le n≈ìud `Ask Human for Help`.
    *   Dans le champ **Send To**, remplacez l'adresse e-mail de remplacement par l'adresse e-mail r√©elle de votre expert humain (par exemple, votre propre e-mail ou un e-mail de support d'√©quipe).

6.  **Activez le flux de travail :**
    *   Une fois tous les credentials et configurations d√©finis, activez le flux de travail en utilisant le commutateur √† bascule en haut √† droite de votre toile n8n.

**Commencez √† apprendre !**
Envoyez un e-mail test au compte Gmail connect√© au n≈ìud `On New Email Received`. Observez comment l'IA r√©pond, ou comment elle escalade vers l'e-mail de votre expert et apprend ensuite de la r√©ponse. V√©rifiez votre Google Sheet pour voir de nouvelles paires Q&R ajout√©es !

parameters.text:
=<inputs>
<customer_question>
{{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.text }}
</customer_question>
<expert_answer>
{{ $('Ask Human for Help').last().json.data.text }}
</expert_answer>
</inputs>

messageValues.message:
=<role>
You are an expert AI assistant specialized in knowledge base management. Your task is to distill human conversations into clean, reusable question-and-answer pairs for an automated support system. You must transform a specific customer query and an expert's ad-hoc reply into a generic, canonical entry that can be used to help many other users in the future.
</role>

<instructions>
<goal>
Your goal is to take an original customer question and the corresponding answer provided by a human expert, and transform them into a standardized, generic, and reusable Question/Answer pair. This new entry must be suitable for an automated system to use for future, similar inquiries.
</goal>

<context>
This task is part of a 'human-in-the-loop' automated customer support workflow. When the system cannot answer a customer's email using its existing knowledge base (a Google Sheet), the question is forwarded to a human expert. You are now receiving the original question and the expert's reply.

Your generated Q&A pair will be added as a new row to the Google Sheet knowledge base. This will allow the system to answer this question automatically next time.

Key principles to follow:
1.  **Generalize the Question:** Rephrase the customer's question to be generic and universally applicable. Remove any personal information (names, specific order numbers, account details, etc.) and formulate it as a general query that other customers might ask.
2.  **Refine the Answer:** Clean up the expert's reply. It should be a complete, well-formatted, and polite response that is ready to be sent directly to a customer without further editing. Remove conversational filler like "Hi John," or "Hope this helps!".
3.  **Capture the Essence:** The final Q&A pair should accurately represent the core problem and its solution.
</context>

<examples>
<example_1>
<inputs>
<customer_question>
Hi, my name is Jane Doe and I ordered a blue widget last Tuesday (order #12345). I haven't received a shipping confirmation yet. Can you tell me how long shipping usually takes to California? Thanks, Jane
</customer_question>
<expert_answer>
Hey Jane, I checked your order. It's currently being processed. For future reference, our standard shipping to the US West Coast is typically 5-7 business days. Cheers.
</expert_answer>
</inputs>
<output>
{
  "question": "What are the standard shipping times to the US West Coast?",
  "answer": "Standard shipping to the US West Coast typically takes 5-7 business days after your order has been processed. You will receive a shipping confirmation email with a tracking number as soon as your order is dispatched."
}
</output>
</example_1>

<example_2>
<inputs>
<customer_question>
I can't find where to reset my API key on my dashboard. I looked in the settings but it's not there. Help!
</customer_question>
<expert_answer>
No problem. To do that, you need to go to the 'Developer' section, not 'Settings'. From there, you'll see a 'Revoke Key' button. Click that and a new one will be generated for you.
</expert_answer>
</inputs>
<output>
{
  "question": "How do I reset my API key?",
  "answer": "You can reset your API key by following these steps:\n1. Log in to your account and navigate to the 'Developer' section in your dashboard.\n2. Click on the 'Revoke Key' button.\n3. A new API key will be automatically generated for you."
}
</output>
</example_2>

<example_3>
<inputs>
<customer_question>
my bill is higher this month?? i dont understand why
</customer_question>
<expert_answer>
Hi, we recently updated our pricing for the Pro plan from $49/month to $55/month to reflect new features we've added. We sent out an email about this last month. This is the first billing cycle with the new price.
</expert_answer>
</inputs>
<output>
{
  "question": "Why did my monthly subscription price increase?",
  "answer": "We recently updated our pricing to reflect the addition of new features to our plans. If you have noticed an increase in your monthly bill, it is likely due to this planned pricing adjustment. All users were notified via email prior to the change."
}
</output>
</example_3>
</examples>


<output_format>
You must provide your response as a single, valid JSON object. The object should contain two keys: "question" and "answer". Do not include any other text, explanations, or markdown formatting around the JSON object.

{
  "question": "The generated generic question.",
  "answer": "The clean, customer-ready answer."
}
</output_format>
</instructions>

<inputs>
<customer_question>
[The original, verbatim email or question from the customer.]
</customer_question>
<expert_answer>
[The verbatim reply provided by the human expert.]
</expert_answer>
</inputs>

parameters.message:
=Hello,

Our automated support system has received a question for which we don't yet have an answer in our knowledge base.

**ORIGINAL CUSTOMER QUESTION:** {{ $('Find Answer with AI').last().json.output.summarizedQuestion }}
---
From: {{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.from.value[0].address }}
Subject: {{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.subject }}

{{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.text }}
---

**ACTION REQUIRED:**
Please reply to this email with:
1. The complete answer to provide to the customer
2. Any additional information that might be useful for similar questions

Your response will automatically be:
- Sent to the customer ({{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.from.value[0].address }})
- Added to our knowledge base for future similar questions

Best regards,
Automated Support System
parameters.subject: [AUTO SUPPORT] New question requiring your expertise

parameters.content:
### How it Works

**‚úÖ If an answer is found:**
The AI sends the reply directly.

**‚ùì If no answer is found:**
1.  An email is sent to a human expert.
2.  The expert's reply is used to create a new Q&A.
3.  The knowledge base is updated for future responses.

parameters.text:
=<inputs>
<customer_email_body>
{{ $('On New Email Received').item.json.text }}
</customer_email_body>
<knowledge_base>
{{ $('Combine into Knowledge Context').last().json.data.toJsonString() }}
</knowledge_base>
</inputs>

messageValues.message:
= You are an expert AI Customer Support Agent. Your specialty is to analyze incoming customer inquiries and determine with high confidence if they can be answered using a provided knowledge base. You are a critical part of an automated workflow that decides whether to send an automated reply or escalate the issue to a human expert. Your goal is to analyze the customer's email and compare it against the entire knowledge base. Based on your analysis, you will perform one of two actions: 1. **If a highly relevant answer is found:** You will draft a complete, polite, and helpful email response in HTML format. 2. **If no relevant answer is found (or if you have low confidence):** You will summarize the customer's core question into a concise sentence for escalation to a human expert. It is better to escalate than to provide a wrong answer. - The knowledge base is a list of pre-existing "Question" and "Answer" pairs. - You must evaluate the semantic meaning of the customer's question, not just keyword matching. - The customer's email might contain greetings, signatures, and other non-essential text. You must focus on the actual question or problem. - Your output will be parsed by a machine, so it must strictly follow the specified JSON format. - If you find an answer, the `response_email_html` should be a complete email, ready to be sent, including a polite greeting and closing. Hello, I can't seem to find where I can reset my password on your platform. Can you help me? Thanks, John Doe [ {"Question": "How to update my billing information?", "Answer": "You can update your billing information in the 'Account > Billing' section of your dashboard."}, {"Question": "How do I reset my password?", "Answer": "To reset your password, please go to the login page and click the 'Forgot Password?' link. You will receive an email with instructions."}, {"Question": "What are your opening hours?", "Answer": "Our support team is available from 9 AM to 5 PM, Monday to Friday."} ] { "answerFound": true, "responseEmailHtml": "

Hello,

Thank you for contacting us.

To reset your password, please go to the login page and click the 'Forgot Password?' link. You will receive an email with instructions to set a new one.

If you need further assistance, please let us know.

Best regards,
The Support Team

", "summarizedQuestion": null } Hi there, My latest invoice (INV-2023-12-45) seems to have a calculation error on the VAT for the 'Pro Plan' line item. It's showing 20% but my company is VAT exempt. Can you check this? Best, Jane Smith [ {"Question": "How to update my billing information?", "Answer": "You can update your billing information in the 'Account > Billing' section of your dashboard."}, {"Question": "Where can I find my invoices?", "Answer": "All your past invoices are available for download in the 'Account > Billing > Invoices' section."}, {"Question": "How do I reset my password?", "Answer": "To reset your password, please go to the login page and click the 'Forgot Password?' link."} ] { "answerFound": false, "responseEmailHtml": null, "summarizedQuestion": "Customer is reporting a specific VAT calculation error on their latest invoice." } You MUST provide your response as a single, valid JSON object. Do not add any text before or after the JSON object. The JSON object must have the following structure: ```json { "answerFound": , "responseEmailHtml": , "summarizedQuestion": } ``` - `answerFound`: (boolean) Set to `true` ONLY if you found a highly relevant answer in the knowledge base with high confidence. Otherwise, set to `false`. - `responseEmailHtml`: (string or null) If `answer_found` is `true`, this field must contain the full HTML content of the email to be sent to the customer. If `answer_found` is `false`, this field must be `null`. - `summarizedQuestion`: (string or null) If `answer_found` is `false`, this field must contain a concise, one-sentence summary of the customer's problem for a human expert. If `answer_found` is `true`, this field must be `null`. [The full, raw text content of the incoming customer email will be placed here.] [A JSON array of objects, where each object has a "Question" and "Answer" key, representing the entire knowledge base from the Google Sheet, will be placed here.]

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ Self Improving Email AI Support

This workflow answers emails using a Google Sheet as a knowledge base.

If it doesn't know the answer, it asks a human and **learns the new reply automatically**.

### To get started:
1.  **Connect your credentials** for Gmail, Google Sheets, and Google Gemini (see red sticky notes).
2.  **Set up your Google Sheet** knowledge base (see red sticky note).
3.  **Customize the expert email** address in the `Ask Human for Help` node (see purple sticky note).
4.  **Activate** the workflow to start processing emails.


### Get Your Personalized n8n Roadmap
Instantly generate a free, step-by-step plan based on your automation goals.

‚û°Ô∏è **[Build Your Free Roadmap Now](https://free.workflows.ac?s=template&t=8779&a=Frank)**


---

*Happy Automating! ‚ÄîLucas Peyrin*

This workflow uses Google Gemini models for AI tasks.

1.  **[Go to Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey)**
2.  Click **‚ÄúCreate API key in new project‚Äù** and copy it.

3.  Open the ```Google Gemini 2.5 Pro``` node:
    *   **Select Credential ‚Üí Create New**
    *   Paste into **API Key** and **Save**

This workflow uses a Google Sheet as its knowledge base.

1.  **Create a new Google Sheet** in your Google Drive.
2.  Name the first sheet `QA Database`.
3.  Add two column headers: `Question` and `Answer`.
4.  **Open the `Get Knowledge Base` node** and select your newly created spreadsheet.
Set the **To** email address for your human expert. This is where questions the AI can't answer will be forwarded.

This is the core AI that attempts to find an answer in your knowledge base.

**Open this node** and adapt the `prompt` to best suit your support context and the type of questions you expect.
This AI node is the 'learning' component. After a human expert replies, this AI processes their answer and the original question to create a new, reusable Q&A pair for your knowledge base.
These nodes ensure the AI's output is always in a strict JSON format, making it reliable and easy for the workflow to process.
This node uses AI to classify incoming emails, ensuring only relevant support requests proceed through the workflow.
üí° Once configured, activate this workflow to start automatically processing incoming emails!
Check your Google Sheet! New Q&A pairs generated by the AI (from human expert replies) will be added here.

user.name: Lucas Peyrin

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
